meanings.definition: The plural form of midair: collisions between two flying objects.
meanings.sent1: The birds had midairs when they accidentally crashed into each other.
meanings.sent2: Pilots are trained to avoid midairs to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: The midairs between the kites made for an unexpected air show.
meanings.sent4: The midairs of ideas in the meeting room led to a creative explosion.
meanings.sent5: The midairs of the paper airplanes created a beautiful chaos in the classroom.

meanings.sent1: The geese midairs during their migration south.
meanings.sent2: The drones midairs while filming the aerial footage.
meanings.sent3: The two friends midairs playfully while jumping on the trampoline.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts midairs in his mind, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The basketball players midairs for the rebound, trying to outjump each other.
